pages.title: Welcome, Tinkerer
pages.text: So... you built your first automated crop farm, did you? You've tasted the power of motion.You've witnessed your crops harvest themselves. And now, you want more. Good.

pages.title: The Bones of a Machine
pages.text: $(br)Every contraption begins with two things... $(#f00)$(l)Power $() and $(#f00)$(l)Purpose. $()Automation is a loop: $(#b182e5)$(l)Power,  $(#e5e582)Motion,  $(#e58282)Action,  $(#82d7e5)Results.

pages.title: Farm Tips
pages.text: $(li)Use $(#FFAA00)$(l)Brass Funnels $()to filter outputs.$(li)Stack $(#7BC35C)$(l)Bearings   $()to grow large farms.$(li)Use $(#AAAAAA)$(l)Deployers   $()to replant seeds for full automation.

pages.title: Things to Try Next
pages.text: $(br)Try $(#c6c6c6)$(l)Mechanical Mixers,  $(#ff9c00)Crafters,   $()and $(#ed83ff)$(l)Sequenced Assembly   $()for more complex automation. Yes... eventually... even $(#83b1ff)$(l)Trains.

pages.title: Final Words
pages.text: $(br)Your machines will grow more complex. Your gears will spin faster. But don't forget your first harvest. May your shafts never snap, and your belts stay turning. $(l)- 2013 T.M. Gearsprocket
